title: In PoA network, Signer node doesn't work and "Persisted the clean trie cache" printed by Geth!
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.10.23`
OS & Version: Windows Server 2019

#### Expected behaviour

I expect signer nodes do their job, validate transactions and seal block. Moreover, I expect we see sealing logs on their PowerShells.

#### Actual behaviour

They don't their job and we face to timed out error when a transaction sent by application. Geth logs on PowerShell are:

```
INFO [03-06|13:37:36.957] Writing clean trie cache to disk
INFO [03-06|13:37:36.971] Regenerated local transaction journal
INFO [03-06|13:37:36.973] Persisted the clean trie cache
```
What do the log say and what should I do?
Are you running your own private network? Do you check that if a half of signers are offline so network is stuck? Do you ensure that all signers are connected correctly?

> Are you running your own private network? Do you check that if a half of signers are offline so network is stuck? Do you ensure that all signers are connected correctly?

Yes, I'm running my own private network, a network by 6 systems. 
Yes, I checked all signers are online.
Yes, They are connected correctly.

I guess there is no connection issue, There is a Geth issue!
Please provide more logs from signers.

> Please provide more logs from signers.

All is this:

```
INFO [03-06|21:44:16.961] Writing clean trie cache to disk         path=C:\Users\karbasi\AppData\Local\geth\triecache threads=1

First up, please use the latest version of Geth so we don't debug something that might have been fixed a long timer ago. Then, please provide the commands that you used to initialize your private network and the ones you use to run your nodes. That might point to some issues.

> 
 I try this command to initialize my private network:
 
` geth --datadir C:\. . .\Local  --identity "PrivEth" init "C:\. . .\Local\Genesis.json"`

I try this command to run signer nodes:

`geth --datadir C:\. . .\Local --cache 256 --identity "PrivEth" --networkid 1111 --port 30300 --netrestrict 192.168.10.0/24  --nat extip:192.168.10.24 --ws --allow-insecure-unlock --ws.addr 192.168.10.24 --ws.port 8551 --ws.api eth,net,web3,personal,admin,miner --ws.origins "*" --mine --miner.threads 10`

And I try this command to run other nodes:

`geth --datadir C:\. . .\Local --cache 256 --identity "PrivEth" --networkid 1111 --port 30300 --netrestrict 192.168.10.0/24  --nat extip:192.168.10.24 --ws --allow-insecure-unlock --ws.addr 192.168.10.24 --ws.port 8551 --ws.api eth,net,web3,personal,admin,miner --ws.origins "*"`

About the latest version, I will try it and feedback here.

@karalabe 
I tried the latest version of Geth recently, but the same issue is alive yet.

1) I initialized Geth:
`geth --datadir C:\. . .\Local  --identity "PrivEth" init "C:\. . .\Local\Genesis.json"`

2) I run signers:
`geth --datadir C:\. . .\Local --cache 256 --identity "PrivEth" --networkid 1111 --port 30300 --netrestrict 192.168.10.0/24  --nat extip:192.168.10.24 --ws --allow-insecure-unlock --ws.addr 192.168.10.24 --ws.port 8551 --ws.api eth,net,web3,personal,admin,miner --ws.origins "*" --mine --miner.threads 10 --miner.etherbase <address>`

3) I run other nodes:
`geth --datadir C:\. . .\Local --cache 256 --identity "PrivEth" --networkid 1111 --port 30300 --netrestrict 192.168.10.0/24  --nat extip:192.168.10.24 --ws --allow-insecure-unlock --ws.addr 192.168.10.24 --ws.port 8551 --ws.api eth,net,web3,personal,admin,miner --ws.origins "*"`

4) I peered all nodes by `admin.addPeer(<enode>)`.

This is the resulted by Geth:
```

I opened a new issue about that here: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/26923
